title: Do NOT Plug This USB In! – Hak5 Rubber Ducky
description:
Visit https://www.squarespace.com/LTT and use offer code LTT for 10% off

Create your build at https://www.buildredux.com/linus

The Hak5 Rubber Ducky is a dangerous hacking tool that disguises itself as an unassuming USB flash drive. It delivers payloads by injecting keystrokes while appearing to its host system as a regular old keyboard.

Discuss on the forum: https://linustechtips.com/topic/1467579-do-not-plug-this-into-anything-%E2%80%93-hak5-rubber-ducky/

Buy the Hak5 Rubber Ducky here: https://shop.hak5.org/products/usb-rubber-ducky

Purchases made through some store links may provide some compensation to Linus Media Group.

► GET MERCH: https://lttstore.com
► SUPPORT US ON FLOATPLANE: https://www.floatplane.com/ltt

title: I Have to Pirate COLOURS Now?? - Pantone Connect + Adobe split
description:
TEAMGROUP's Black Friday/Cyber Monday Sale: https://bit.ly/3FffwDC
TEAMGROUP Delta RGB DDR5 6400 - White at Micro Center: https://bit.ly/3CGMObR

Buy a Seasonic Prime TX-1600: https://geni.us/TBRYP9U

Pantone recently decided that their expensive plastic chips and colour matching binders were not making enough money. Now, even old files will stop working if you don’t pay up.

Discuss on the forum: https://linustechtips.com/topic/1467378-i-have-to-pirate-colours-now/

Purchases made through some store links may provide some compensation to Linus Media Group.
